description: Request an Uber or Uber delivery all from within your app.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Uber.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Uber.

blocks.name: requestDelivery
blocks.description: The Delivery endpoint allows a delivery to be requested given the delivery information and quote ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: itemsTitle
args.info: The title of the item. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: itemsQuantity
args.info: The number of this item.

args.name: itemsPrice
args.info: The price of the item.

args.name: itemsCurrencyCode
args.info: The currency code of the item price. The currency code follows the ISO 4217 standard.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery pickup location such as "CA".

args.name: pickupLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the pickup location such as "US".

args.name: pickupContactFirstName
args.info: The first name of the contact. This field is optional if pickup.contact.company_name is provided. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactLastName
args.info: The last name of the contact. This field is optional if pickup.contact.company_name is provided. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactEmail
args.info: The email of the contact.

args.name: pickupContactPhoneNumber
args.info: The phone number of the contact. Phone number should start with + followed by the country code and then the local number (e.g., +18005555555).

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery drop-off location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery drop-off location such as "CA".

args.name: dropoffLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the delivery pickup location such as "US".

args.name: dropoffContactFirstName
args.info: The first name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffContactLastName
args.info: The last name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffContactEmail
args.info: The email of the contact.

args.name: dropoffContactPhoneNumber
args.info: The phone number of the contact.

args.name: dropoffContactPhoneSmsEnabled
args.info: If the phone has SMS capabilities. True or false.

args.name: quoteId
args.info: The ID of the quoted price of the delivery. This field is optional. If missing, the fee for the delivery will be determined at the time of request.

args.name: orderReferenceId
args.info: The merchant-supplied order reference identifier. This field is optional. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: itemsWidth
args.info: The width of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsHeight
args.info: The height of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsLength
args.info: The length of the item in inches.

args.name: itemsWeight
args.info: The weight of the item in pounds.

args.name: itemsIsFragile
args.info: If the item is fragile. True or false. Default to false.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery pickup location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupLocation
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: pickupContactCompanyName
args.info: The company name of the contact. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupContactPhoneSmsEnabled
args.info: If the phone has SMS capabilities. True or false.

args.name: pickupSpecialInstructions
args.info: Special instructions for the pickup. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocation
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffContactSendEmailNotifications
args.info: If Uber should send email delivery notifications. True or false. Default to true.

args.name: dropoffContactSendSmsNotifications
args.info: If Uber should send SMS delivery notifications. True or false. Default to true.

args.name: dropoffSpecialInstructions
args.info: Special instructions for the drop-off. Limited to 256 characters.

args.name: dropoffSignatureRequired
args.info: If signature is required for drop-off. True or false. Default to false.

args.name: includesAlcohol
args.info: Indicates if the delivery includes alcohol. True or false. This feature is only available to whitelisted businesses.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getDelivery
blocks.description: Get the real time status of an ongoing delivery that was created using the Delivery endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: deliveryId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Delivery.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: deliveryId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Delivery.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getDeliveries
blocks.description: Get a list of all deliveries, ordered chronologically by time of creation.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: offset
args.info: Offset the list of returned results by this amount.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of items to retrieve. Maximum is 50.

args.name: status
args.info: A status value to filter for. List of status strings can be found https://developer.uber.com/docs/rush/statuses. Additionally supports a value of active that will return all ongoing deliveries. A delivery is considered active if the status field value is either en_route_to_pickup, at_pickup, en_route_to_dropoff or at_dropoff.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getQuote
blocks.description: Generate a delivery quote, given a pickup and dropoff location. On-demand and scheduled delivery quotes will be returned.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: pickupLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery pickup location such as "CA".

args.name: pickupLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery pickup location.

args.name: pickupLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the pickup location such as "US".

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress
args.info: The top address line of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery drop-off location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: dropoffLocationCity
args.info: The city of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationState
args.info: The state of the delivery drop-off location such as "CA".

args.name: dropoffLocationPostalCode
args.info: The postal code of the delivery drop-off location.

args.name: dropoffLocationCountry
args.info: The country of the delivery pickup location such as "US".

args.name: pickupLocationAddress2
args.info: The second address line of the delivery pickup location such as the apartment number. Limited to 128 characters.

args.name: pickupLocation
args.info: Latitude ang longitude of the pickup location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: dropoffLocation
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the dropoff location. If UberRUSH cannot geocode the given address, the latitude and longitude coordinates will be used if provided.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False
